user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DeleteAllObjects:
```c
void OS_DeleteAllObjects(void)
{
    uint32 ObjectCount;
    uint32 TryCount;

    /*
     * Note - this is done in a loop because some objects depend on other objects
     * and you will not be able to delete the object until the ref count becomes zero.
     */
    TryCount = 0;
    while (true)
    {
        ObjectCount = 0;
        ++TryCount;

        /* Delete timers and tasks first, as they could be actively using other object types  */
        OS_ForEachObjectOfType(OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB, OS_OBJECT_CREATOR_ANY, OS_CleanUpObject, &ObjectCount);
        OS_ForEachObjectOfType(OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE, OS_OBJECT_CREATOR_ANY, OS_CleanUpObject, &ObjectCount);
        OS_ForEachObjectOfType(OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK, OS_OBJECT_CREATOR_ANY, OS_CleanUpObject, &ObjectCount);

        /* Then try to delete all other remaining objects of any type */
        OS_ForEachObject(OS_OBJECT_CREATOR_ANY, OS_CleanUpObject, &ObjectCount);

        if (ObjectCount == 0 || TryCount > 4)
        {
            break;
        }
        OS_TaskDelay(5);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_DeleteAllObjects:
void OS_ForEachObjectOfType(osal_objtype_t idtype, osal_id_t creator_id, OS_ArgCallback_t callback_ptr,
                            void *callback_arg)
{
    OS_object_iter_t    iter;
    OS_creator_filter_t filter;

    filter.creator_id    = creator_id;
    filter.user_callback = callback_ptr;
    filter.user_arg      = callback_arg;

    if (OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit(OS_ForEachFilterCreator, &filter, idtype, &iter) == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
        {
            OS_ObjectIdIteratorProcessEntry(&iter, OS_ForEachDoCallback);
        }

        OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(&iter);
    }
}
...
void OS_ForEachObject(osal_id_t creator_id, OS_ArgCallback_t callback_ptr, void *callback_arg)
{
    osal_objtype_t idtype;

    for (idtype = 0; idtype < OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER; ++idtype)
    {
        OS_ForEachObjectOfType(idtype, creator_id, callback_ptr, callback_arg);
    }
}
...
void OS_CleanUpObject(osal_id_t object_id, void *arg)
{
    uint32 *ObjectCount;

    ObjectCount = (uint32 *)arg;
    ++(*ObjectCount);
    switch (OS_IdentifyObject(object_id))
    {
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK:
            OS_TaskDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_QUEUE:
            OS_QueueDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_BINSEM:
            OS_BinSemDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_COUNTSEM:
            OS_CountSemDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MUTEX:
            OS_MutSemDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MODULE:
            OS_ModuleUnload(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE:
            OS_TimeBaseDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB:
            OS_TimerDelete(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM:
            OS_close(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_DIR:
            OS_DirectoryClose(object_id);
            break;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR:
            OS_CondVarDelete(object_id);
            break;
        default:
            break;
    }
}
...
int32 OS_TaskDelay(uint32 millisecond)
{
    /* just call the implementation */
    return OS_TaskDelay_Impl(millisecond);
}
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB 0x09
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE 0x08
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK 0x01
...
#define OS_OBJECT_CREATOR_ANY OS_OBJECT_ID_UNDEFINED
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
Other loop/control constructs in the provided code do not require investigation for Rule 14.3 because their controlling expressions are not invariant: 
- while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter)) depends on the iterator state returned by a function call and is not a constant/invariant expression.
- for (idtype = 0; idtype < OS_OBJECT_TYPE_USER; ++idtype) modifies the loop variable and its controlling expression depends on that variable (not invariant).
- The if (OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit(...) == OS_SUCCESS) condition is a normal runtime test, not an invariant controlling expression.
- No do-while with an essentially Boolean constant false is present.
- Other statements (switch, function calls, macro definitions) are not loop controlling expressions and therefore are not relevant to Rule 14.3.

Only the shown while (true) loop contains an invariant controlling expression and thus is reported for investigation.
